description: Foundational physics concepts that underpin Principia Metaphysica

gravity.description: The mathematical framework describing gravity, spacetime curvature, and the geometric nature of gravitational phenomena.

items.title: Einstein Field Equations
items.summary: The fundamental equations of General Relativity describing how matter and energy curve spacetime.

items.title: Einstein-Hilbert Action
items.summary: The variational principle from which Einstein's field equations are derived.

items.title: Ricci Tensor & Scalar
items.summary: Mathematical objects describing the curvature of spacetime in General Relativity.

items.title: Metric Tensor
items.summary: The fundamental object describing distances and geometry in curved spacetime.

quantum.description: The quantum mechanical framework for particles and fields, including relativistic wave equations and gauge theories.

items.title: Dirac Equation
items.summary: The relativistic quantum equation describing spin-1/2 fermions like electrons.

items.title: Dirac Lagrangian
items.summary: The Lagrangian formulation of the Dirac equation for fermion dynamics.

items.title: Clifford Algebra
items.summary: The anticommutation relations defining the gamma matrices used in the Dirac equation.

items.title: Yang-Mills Theory
items.summary: Non-abelian gauge theory forming the basis of the Standard Model gauge structure.

items.title: Dirac Spinors
items.summary: Four-component wavefunctions describing fermions with both left and right chirality.

unification.description: Theoretical frameworks for unifying forces through extra dimensions and higher symmetries.

items.title: Kaluza-Klein Theory
items.summary: Dimensional reduction mechanism unifying gravity and electromagnetism through extra dimensions.

items.title: G₂ Manifolds
items.summary: Seven-dimensional Riemannian manifolds with special holonomy, used for M-theory compactifications.

items.title: Calabi-Yau Manifolds
items.summary: Complex manifolds with SU(n) holonomy used in string theory compactifications.

items.title: SO(10) Grand Unification
items.summary: Grand unified theory embedding the Standard Model in a single SO(10) gauge group.

thermodynamics.description: The connection between thermodynamics, entropy, and the emergence of time from quantum information.

items.title: Boltzmann Entropy
items.summary: Statistical definition of entropy relating disorder to the number of microstates.

items.title: KMS Condition
items.summary: Mathematical characterization of thermal equilibrium in quantum field theory.

items.title: Tomita-Takesaki Theory
items.summary: Mathematical framework connecting thermodynamics to the structure of quantum algebras.

items.title: Hawking Temperature
items.summary: Temperature of thermal radiation emitted by black holes due to quantum effects.

items.title: Unruh Effect
items.summary: Accelerated observers detect thermal radiation in the quantum vacuum.

algebra.description: The algebraic and geometric structures underlying modern theoretical physics.

items.title: Clifford Algebra
items.summary: Geometric algebra encoding spacetime structure through gamma matrix anticommutation.

geometry.description: The mathematical tools for describing curved spaces and their properties.

items.title: Metric Tensor
items.summary: Defines the geometry of spacetime, measuring distances and angles.

items.title: Ricci Tensor
items.summary: Contraction of the Riemann curvature tensor describing spacetime curvature.
